ratings.comment: Took her Kafka class and would take again! One of my favorite professors at Madison!!

Took Kafka. Not difficult, very fun professor. Very kind, interacts with everyone, and is cool. 2 absences total, and we read cool material. You can get by with not doing all of the readings, but as you get grouped with random peers a lot, not reading hinders discussion and makes things awkward.
German 275. Easy class, you can tell the professor cares about the subject. Also she's very sweet and clearly cares about you as a person.
Melissa is the best! Very friendly, knowledgable, and caring. Would definitely take a class from her again!

I can't stress enough how amazing Professor Sheedy was. She was always extremely understanding. There was never that much work. The homework was usually not too long and the writing projects had clear criteria. She gave great feedback on each piece I wrote. The class was great and I was so glad to have her as a professor.

I loved this class and learned a lot. I took this for my 6 credits of literature. Don't be scared because of the title of the class she helps you a lot. The class is organized well and you do a variety of things. The first thing we did was read a comic book based during WW2. This class boosts your GPA and you become close knit with your class.
Prof Sheedy is amazing and the course is very interesting. Criteria for assignments, quizzes, and papers are extremely clear and grading is fair. Highly recommend!

Professor Sheedy is amazing! Very easy lit course if you put in the work. There are weekly discussion posts, 5 short quizzes, 2 short papers, and a final project. Grading was very easy and Melissa sets up the expectations well. Lectures are mandatory and you need to sign in at the beginning of each lecture. Would highly recommend for a lit course.

I loved Melissa! She puts her students first always and it shows. Super easy Lit credit with their being no discussion section and honestly not that much reading. Grade consisted of weekly discussion posts, attendance, 5 quizzes, two small papers, and a final project. Super easy A if you put in a little effort.
Very student-focused and related what we learned in class to the world around us. I am not a literature person, but I did fine in this class.

Professor Sheedy is so so sweet; she is very passionate about the topics and tales we discuss in class. I was skeptical about taking the class given my lack of knowledge on the topic, but all of the tales have been really fun to read. Read the tales, post insightful discussion prompts and sign the attendance sheet in lecture and you will get an A.
She's a sweetheart and this class is sooooo easy. There was a "textbook" that is a book that you read some fairy tales for but I just got a rental from the library

I took German 276 for my literature class requirement, seemed easy, and it was. If you need to fill your lit requirement take this! the class can get kinda annoying because she grades so easily that you feel like not trying and the discussions get boring but its definitely worth taking if you need it. She is very nice! I really liked her

literally SO sweet, i couldn't recommend this professor more. she's super engaged and super passionate abt what she teaches, while at the same time being respectful of students and their time. hw and participation are both easy grades that encourage active learning, so even tho i took this course for fun i genuinely feel like i learned a lot!!

Professor Sheedy is amazing! I loved her positive energy. She was so caring and helpful and we often got to see her cat, Pushkin! Very manageable course if you do the readings and participate in lecture. Lots of group discussions but okay bc the readings were usually short! I loved learning about the fairytales & for a Com B class, this was fun!
